newsitem.title: USA: US copper center shipments up 8.2 percent Jan-Apr.
newsitem.headline: US copper center shipments up 8.2 percent Jan-Apr.

text.p: Total metal shipments from copper service centers in the United States rose 8.2 percent in January to April compared with the same period in 1996, the Copper and Brass Servicenter Association reported on Wednesday.
However, the average daily rate of shipments in April fell slightly from March.
Copper shipments were up 13.6 percent in January to April, compared with the previous year, while alloy shipments were up 5.8 percent.
The largest gains in the first quarter of the year were in copper sheet, coil and strip, up 19.5 percent, and alloy rod and bar, up 8.5 percent.
There was little change in total inventory levels during April, but stocks of copper plate soared nearly 22 percent.
Compared to April last year, inventory of copper products were up 12.6 percent, while stocks of alloy products showed an increase of 3.8 percent from the prior year.
